citeinfo.origin: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 7, Division of Realty
citeinfo.title: Arctic National Wildlife Refuge Legislative Boundary (file name: arcleg)

serinfo.sername: Alaska National Wildlife Refuge Digital Boundary Datasets

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Fish Wildlife Service, Region 7, Division of Realty

descript.abstract:
This dataset consists of one Arc/Info coverage and its associated polygon and arc attributes. The coverage depicts the official legislative boundary of Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, Alaska at a scale of 1:63,360.
This boundary coverage was derived from the following digital sources and legal documents:
1) Federal Register, Vol. 48, No. 38 Thursday, February 24, 1983 Notices Pages 7929-7936
2) USGS 1:250,000 scale Alaska Boundary Series maps entitled:
Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act December 2, 1980 P.L. 96-487
3) National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Nautical Charts and T-sheets NOAA Nautical Chart 16041, 1994 NOAA Nautical Chart 16042, 1990 NOAA Nautical Chart 16043, 1997 NOAA T-sheet TP01507, 1987 NOAA T-sheet TP01508, 1987 NOAA T-sheet TP01509, 1987
4) USGS 1:63,360 scale revised hydrography Digital Line Graphs depicting ground conditions from 1955 to 1986.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this coverage is to depict the legal, legislative boundary for Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, Alaska. The portion of the boundary that follows the coastline of the Actic Ocean is tied to the line of extreme low water from the extreme left bank of the Staines River eastward to the Alaska/Canada border.

idinfo.useconst: Not to be used for legal survey purposes or for the calculation of legal survey acreage.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Fish Wildlife Service, Region 7, Division of Realty

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

browse.browsed: This graphic shows the arcs that comprise the refuge boundary

attracc.attraccr:
Arcs for this coverage were obtained from USGS 1:63,360 scale paper quadrangles and USGS 1:63,360 Digital Line Graphs. Quadrangles were scanned at 400 DPI. Boundary arcs were compiled via on-screen digitizing. Individual map sheet coverages were then mapjoined and attributes were assigned to all arcs and polygons.
Compilation of this coverage is consistent with the standards set forth in "Service Lands Digital Boundary Process for Alaska", dated September 19, 2001, published by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 7, Division of Realty, Anchorage, Alaska.

qattracc.attracce: Attribute accuracy was ensured by generating frequency listings of all polygon and arc attributes. Any errors noted were then corrected.

dataqual.logic: All poylgons are closed and there are no dangling or intersecting arcs. There is one label point per polygon. Polygons and arcs are fully attributed. Refer to the section entitled "Entity and Attribute Overview" for a complete description of all polygon and arc attributes.
dataqual.complete:
This coverage is complete. Situations which may require modification include:
1) Acquisition of revised and/or updated USGS 1:63,360 quadrangles, DLGs, or DOQQs. 2) Acquisition of revised and/or updated NOAA Nautical Charts and T-sheets 3) Acquisition of revised and/or updated aerial or satellite imagery. 4 Legislative changes to the refuge boundary. 5) Land exchanges which alter the refuge boundary. 6) Acquisition of survey-grade data.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal error of all arcs does not exceed 32 meters, based on National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:63,360 mapping. Those portions of the boundary which follow township lines, section lines, or aliquot parts are accurate to approximately 1 meter. Arcs taken from existing digital data sources retain the accuracy of those datasets.

qhorizpa.horizpae: Horizontal accuracy of all arcs was ensured by on-screen digitizing and by zooming in to the extent necessary to accurately digitize arcs within the lines in the scanned image. The accuracy of the arcs taken from digital data sources such as USGS Digital Line Graphs is the same as the source dataset.

srcinfo.srccitea: Source maps were NOAA ~1:51,000 paper nautical charts, and NOAA 1:50,000 mylar T-sheets.
srcinfo.srccontr: Extreme low water along the Arctic Ocean coastline was used as the basis of the boundary from the Staines River eastward to the Alaska/Canda boundary.

procstep.procdesc:
The creation of this coverage was consistent with the guidelines described in "Service Lands Digital Boundary Process for Alaska", published by the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, Region 7, Division of Realty, September 19, 2001. Refer to this document for full details on the compilation process.
PROCESS SUMMARY
1) Refuge boundary was delineated on USGS 1:63,360 paper quadrangles, using official ANILCA maps and Federal Register boundary description. This was used as a guide in determining which arcs to extract from the USGS hydrography Digital Line Graphs and which section lines to generate.
2) The appropriate arcs were extracted from the hydrography DLGs.
3) The appropriate section lines were generated from the BLS PLSS files.
4) The line of extreme low water of the Arctic Ocean was digitized from the NOAA Nautical Charts and T-sheets.
5) Ridgelines were digitized from the USGS paper quadrangles.
6) Individual ITM quadrangle-based coverages were mapjoined into one overall coverage.
7) All polygons and arcs were attributed.
8) The coverage was checked for errors and corrected if necessary.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Region 7, Division of Realty

srcinfo.srccontr: Portions of the refuge boundary which follow township lines, range lines, sections lines, or aliquot part descriptions were generated based on BLM PLSS coordinate files.

citeinfo.title: Public Land Survey System Geographic Coordinate Database

srcinfo.srccontr: Mean high water, as depicted on the most recent USGS 1:63,360 hydrography Digital Line Graphs, was used as the basis for the refuge boundary along the Yukon River, islands within the Yukon River, and other portions of the boundary which are described with respect to hydrographic features.
USGS 1:63,360 paper quadrangles were used to obtain those portions of the refuge boundary which followed ridgelines or other features not tied to hydrography or the PLSS.

overview.eadetcit:
Refer to "Service Lands Digital Boundary Process for Alaska" for a complete definition and description of the polygon and arc attributes. This report can be obtained from the following address:
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service Division of Realty 1011 E. Tudor Road Anchorage, AK 99503
overview.dsoverv: This dataset contains polygon and arc features. Polygons are attributed with the refuge number, refuge name, unit name, acreage, and UTM zone. Arcs are attributed with the same items as well as quad or DLG name, source scale, source imagery date, and revision date.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Fish Wildlife Service, Region 7, Division of Realty

distinfo.distliab:
DISTRIBUTION LIABILITY:
The U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics ("JPG" format files) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an FWS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U. S. Fish and Wildlife Service, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
